website_summaries.verdict: If you want to take your games to a tablet, the Nvidia Shield Tablet K1 delivers a top-notch gaming experience and a robust feature set for a very reasonable price.
pros: GeForce Now cloud gaming brings PC titles to the tablet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for the Nexus 7
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement for my kids's Nexus 7 that they broke. This is the perfect upgrade. Stock Android, and the price is right. Everything feels much smoother w/ the updated processor and more ram. Note this does not come w/ a charger. Not a big deal as i have plenty of micro usb chargers. Only thing i wish was that the tablets had Quick Charge built in them. When my kids use up all the battery, it can seem like a lifetime for them to charge mainly because theyll come up to me every 15 mins asking if its done.
customer_reviews.author: teng

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet. Price keeps going up though
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tablet. I bought this for playing the occasional game, but mainly as an alternative to my laptop for traveling. I am not disappointed. The product has served me well for about a year now and continues to satisfy my needs. The only complaint is that I've noticed that the price has jumped from 200 to 275 in the past year, with no apparent improvement in hardware (maybe there was but it's not listed in the Amazon specs). IF the price were still at 200, I would have bought a second one by now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tablet at a great price. Bought it to take notes at school, bought the directstylus directly from nvidia (this works extremely well). Can stream my games from my computer at home with the controller. Despite it being plastic, it still feels high quality. The battery life is fairly good (for its specs) without underclocking, if you underclocking it (which can be done in settings) it will get really good battery life. I only have one minor complaint, the power button is relatively hard to press (perhaps this is just an issue with my unit?) But I solved that by buying the flip cover.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Khan

customer_reviews.title: Nvidia Shield K1 SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: Slow ui, drains battery in sleep mode , wifi issues, apps constantly stop working. But the best thing is , I've written to Nvidia about 5 times now and........NOT ONE SINGLE RESPONSE !! Biggest waste of $200 ever.
customer_reviews.author: wetware

customer_reviews.title: Good luck with battery
customer_reviews.text: My so bought this with his birthday money and the performance was as advertised. But about 4 months in the tablet would last two hours even plugged in, and we eventually got Nvidia to RMA the tablet for battery problems. They sent a replacement, and.... same problem. Since there is no quickcharge feature, even plugged in the battery drains and he can get a few hours in before it shuts down. the hardware is nice, but with these power issues, it's definitely a no-go for us. Back to the drawing board and researching other tablets...
customer_reviews.author: JD the tired dad

customer_reviews.title: Best bang/buck out there for Android!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for wife to replace an original Nexus 7 so I've only installed one game on it but DAMM, this thing is FAST!. She has a browser/Facebook/Messenger/Ebay apps all running at the same time, ZERO issues!. Kinda weird that it does not come with a charger but really, who doesn't have a 5V mini-USB charger lying around. You can also charge it from a PC by plugging it into the PC's USB port. Very sturdy construction, much better than average sound for a tablet,(the speakers are in the FRONT inside a small chamber, GREAT idea!). More screen real estate due to the "8 form-factor, IMHO you simply CAN'T do better for this price!.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J. Aiello

customer_reviews.title: Worse tablet I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was expensive and I thought it would be more durable. I do not know if i just have a lemon or something but this tablet runs extremely slow and the touch display does not respond all of the time. One time I could not get it to charge with the charger or turn on. What made it turn on is when I connected it to the CPU to charge. Very unreliable and not worth the price IMHO. I barely attempt to use this thing.
customer_reviews.author: djdandylion

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet on the market even if it is technically discontinued.
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet I've ever owned or even used (including iPads), nVidia customer support has been awesome: USB port died, nVidia paid for shipping, and sent a replacement out post haste. Will probably purchase a gen 2 Nintendo Switch when it's finally time to upgrade as nVidia stopped making the K1 in order to partner w/ Nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Despite it being a couple years old, it is still standing up to some of the bigger and "better" tablets. The processing power blows me away. With that said, it does get pretty warm during prolonged gaming sessions (couple hours) and it's a little difficult to stream games on most wifi connections as you're better off with a gaming modem and high speed internet. I loved the mini HDMI and hooked it up to my LED TV pretty often for gaming, movies and just general web browsing. It was also easily rooted and I managed to install a few different ROMS that I downloaded from XDA-Devs. I'm glad this is really holding up to the times. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Steele

customer_reviews.title: WiFi constantly drops DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is trash, the WiFi drops out constantly and the only way to get it reconnected is a full off/on cycle. On a WiFi only device, having the WiFi not work is unacceptable and means that the product is fundamentally broken. I'm trying to return mine now and no one is being helpful. DO NOT Buy unless you're really into being frustrated and have a love for broken devices.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bogart

customer_reviews.title: but it's fine even outdoors
customer_reviews.text: This thing flies! Powerful hardware and it's been nothing but reliable for me. Nvidia had an issue for a while there with one of the Android updates, but they jumped on the issue and fixed the bugs with software updates and they seem very responsive to user input on their user forum. The screen is not the brightest, but it's fine even outdoors. I added a non-glare matte finish screen protector which helps a bit outside. I use it with my DJI Phantom 3 and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Mutza

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this product as I'm a big customer of their ...
customer_reviews.text: After having this product for over a year, I wanted to love this product as I'm a big customer of their graphics cards, it performed pretty well while it was working, but the battery life just gave up. I tried to see if any local companies were willing to change the battery on this product, but they all wanted to avoid on trying to fix it. I then tried to get help from Nvida customer service if there was anything they can do, but pretty much didn't want to help me because it was over the warranty period
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Best Android tablet I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I received this tablet the other day and am completely blown away! I've used a few other Android tablets previously from Samsumg, Amazon, Vizio, etc and this blows them out of the water. From the screen, to the snapiness, to the soumd quality (relative to other phones and tablets), to the fact that it's basically running a vanilla 7.0 OS, this tablet has far exceeded my expectations. It rivals the quality of an iPad which I personally could not say for any other Android tablets. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: B. Lazaroff

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept, great specs for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's decent for the price, but it is quite laggy for how powerful it is supposed to be. Also having to mount a sd card is annoying. Battery life sucks, can't really get through an international flight. Speakers pretty good, but can't overpower a toilet fan if you use it there. There's really only one reason to get it, which is for the controller. The screen is actually pretty good for it's price range. There aren't many tablets I think are better for the price, however. It is pretty good because of it's screen for netflix and traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great responsive little tablet --  built for gaming but fantastic for browsing!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as the best small tablet available - I think that might be true. Have read the reviews about people losing wifi connection. I'm not experiencing any issues. Installed Marshmallow immediately with no issues. I only use this for web browsing and haven't trialed gaming - sorry no review for that but the browser responsiveness is really smooth. Okay I have one nit... I don't like the buttons - on off and volume are hard to fiddle with -Sorry Nvidia but lost one star for those little buttons.
customer_reviews.author: MikkNj

customer_reviews.title: Best budget Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Tablet. I wanted a Nokia N1 but I guess it will never come to the US. Also looked at Samsung Tab S2 but decided on this for the obvious reason of price and tablet processing power. Do a quick google search and you'll find lots of reviews professing it as one if not the top budget tablet on the market with longevity. As reported their were... I say again were many problems but since the recent software upgrade and updates it have not encountered any of the reported problems such as unusually quick battery drain and WiFi connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Pnut Bandit

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Fast
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Fast, stable, and great battery life. I did update to Android N. I did a complete reset and cleared the "cache" as well. It was fine, but its noticeably better/smoother after doing those two things. The tablet is great. I wanted something like the fire hd 8 but just prettier. This is it. Paid 230 for mine and its worth every dollar. Its nice being back in Android's ecosystem. Oh how I missed you.
customer_reviews.author: Zach JSB

customer_reviews.title: NICE TABLET NEEDS SOME  IMPROVMENTS
customer_reviews.text: All in all this tablet works great, the pictures are crisp and sharp. It is powerful and quick. Now what needs improvement... the power switch is difficult to activate as many reviewers have stated... also it needs a bigger battery... compared to the other tablets I have owned this needs to be charged much more frequently... also the screen is indeed a "Magnet" to fingerprints. A screen protector would probably fix that, however I have not found one which to my liking. It seems there are not too many available for this model. Would I recommend... if you can deal with misforgivings... then yes. Would I purchase another... probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a few problems
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good base tablet and does play some games very well however some things do hold it back. When using the internet browser some websites come up in desktop view and other times in mobile view(which generally run better). Battery life is ok however charging it back up is very slow especially if you are using it while charging (via battery bank). Screen is nice and the front dual stereo is a very good edition compared to alot of tablets that just have the audio coming either from the bottom or the back of the tablet. For its price point there are very few tablets that can compare in terms of overall specs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars because it was a great tablet it just did not work for what I purchased it for. I purchased this tablet because of the reviews said it would work with my Phantom 4 Pro Drone. It did not, so I returned it and bought something that would. Other than that, it was an outstanding tablet bright screen, fast.
customer_reviews.author: Photocop2011

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome, affordable 8" table for high-performance needs (perfect for DJI Phantom 3 Adv/Pro or Inspire 1)
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome 8" table for high-performance needs, such as (in my case) use with a DJI Phantom 3 Advanced Quadcopter. The live HD feed requires some serious CPU and GPU horsepower that will overwhelm lesser equipped tablets. This baby handles it perfectly, and is priced very affordably, unlike many of Samsung's tablets. As for the OS, which is Android+Nvidia customization, there are things I like, and things I dislike. I'd rather just have a stock OS, and have access to all updates immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Grade2Pencil

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Nexus 7 replacement after mine bricked and this tablet from Nvidia fits the bill. It does everything I expect from an Android tablet quickly and smoothly plus gives me all the battery life I need. There is limited space with only 16G but it also comes with minimal bloatware. I have more than enough space for my apps and i put media on the SD card, so no issue at all. I haven't tried the Nvidia gaming features, but that's not what I got the tablet for. Can't go wrong for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet ever!
customer_reviews.text: Coolest tab on the market. Love Nvidia new live streaming games. A NVIDIA Controller is a must have to compliment the full functionality of this device. I travel on the road and it's like traveling with my PS4 but only pocket size. Love it! I've owned over 8 tablets all sizes and types from the Samsung line and this one blows them away!
customer_reviews.author: Chains

customer_reviews.title: a great workhorse tablet
customer_reviews.text: For the price, a great workhorse tablet. Have had some minor issues with quality. The initial tablet I received the screen was slightly lifted from the body. A replacement fixed that. One corner of the tablet creaks and clicks if held on that corner which isn't a HUGE deal to me. Other than those two issues I have had no problems with it. Nvidia's latest software update fixed the battery issue a lot of folks were complaining about.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Gaming YEP, General use NOPE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing for two reasons: First, mobile gaming (stuff like Jade Empire Android port etc). Concerning this point, the device excels. I've had a few problems with input lag on PST:EE, but don't want to blame it on the tablet. Yet. Otherwise, excellent little gaming machine. Second, I wanted something to replace my laptop for travel (Facebook, email etc). In terms of general use, this thing is fairly frustrating - constant freezing, general lag. My outdated phone works MUCH better for these applications. Pity, since this thing should crush anything thrown at it. After hours of research regarding optimization and so forth, still no noticeable difference. At any rate, great gaming tablet, poor general use performer.
customer_reviews.author: MazungaZ

customer_reviews.title: Weak screen.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a pile. My sons have had kindle hdx 7's for long time now, and have had no problems. We ordered this about 3 months ago, and there are two small, separate cracks across the screen. Gaming is great, but not if your screen is junk and cracks. We checked with a place that fixes screens, and they said Nvidia does not offer any replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: solid and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Nice product.. nothing earth shattering in terms of performance.. but seems to be solidly built.. and stable after a good year of use... THe power button on the side is a little annoying .. requiring extra effort to depress.. if that sort of thing matters to you.. Other than that nothing really negative comes to mind.. I was looking for a solid tablet in the 7-8 inch range.. running current android version at the time.. for some light gaming.. web browsing, and checking email... and this fit the bill
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Most impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are the first thing to be checked. They're at least as good as HDMI monitor speakers, but their bass response is much better. I'd say their single note alto range is outright spectacular. There are a few Inconsequential glitches such as the play store crashing. To fully charge the battery it might need to be turned off. I have been using a Nexus 5 for Everything so this is an outright upgrade with a real GPU and more than twice the screen area.
customer_reviews.author: Rennkakku

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing. Howerver this tablet is a power hog
customer_reviews.text: POWERFUL gaming tablet with controller connectivity. This is amazing. Howerver this tablet is a power hog. It drains very fast while gaming or watching movies. You will need a 2 amp charger or better to keep this beast powered up. Even then you will eventually need to let it charge as it drains power faster than it can be charged when playing high graphic games. The micro USB charging port started to short within 6 months. It is now very hard to charge. Also the rubber on the front is peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: Gregorio Anilao

customer_reviews.title: The tablet is a great buy. Tablet is great
customer_reviews.text: Word of caution. DO NOT upgrade the OS to Android 6.0 at this time. Leave it as it comes, with Android 5.1. There are many reports of wifi problems with Android 6.0 and this tablet. I am sure there are lots of people that didn't have a problem but why risk it. I am sure Android will fix the bugs but until that time you have been cautioned. This is not a tablet issue, it's an OS issue. The tablet is a great buy. Tablet is great, I did not update mine, all is well. Works well, fast, great screen. My only gripe so far is the on-off button is a little hard to push as it is recessed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: All around great purchase, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: An awesome Android tablet, especially considering the price, compared to many other Android tablets. It even still receives updates, unlike some products that haven't even hit two years old yet. Also features quite powerful hardware, with a CPU that rivals the A9 at some tasks, while still puts up a considerable fight at others, and when you again consider the price, it's amazing. The GPU also supports games even if you override and run them at high settings, and also runs a number of WebGL demos at 60fps. And even though I had to get it separately, the stylus works wonderfully, even if I can't really draw all that well. I'm glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: kode54

customer_reviews.title: For the most part I am pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: I like this tablet so far. Pros 1) The screen is quite nice (although not as nice as other tablets but then what can you expect at this price point). 2) Android 6.0 3) Sturty build 4) Pretty fast (although I've experienced a little lag every now and then). 5) The perfect size at 8.0 inches (atleast for my taste). 6) Dual front facing speakers. 7) 16 x 9 aspect ratio. (I prefer this aspect ratio becuase I watch a lot of videos on my tablets). 8) good price point at $200 Cons 1) No USB cable 2) No wall charger 3) No Stylist Overall I'm very pleased with this tablet so far. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jamar Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Don't like any of the cases for it :-(
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved my 2013 Google Nexus 7 tablet, but I was ready to upgrade. I wish I had done just a little bit more research before taking the plunge on the Nvidia shield K1. I have yet to figure out how to disable some of the Nvidia installed nagware. I'm hoping it won't be too hard once I take the time to look into it. But the big bummer here is that I've just ordered my fourth case for this K1. The first three were all duds. There were several great cases for the Nexus 7, I'm hoping this fourth case I just ordered will be good for the K1.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dreifort

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is fast and apps load fast. Has great battery life. I can squeeze out almost 10 hours a day and not have to plug it in. Haven't really tried out streaming a game to my tablet yet though. Screen is bright and I don't see any washed out colors to my knowledge. Mine did not come with any backlight bleed. The front facing speaking sound great. A little distortion can be heard at high volume though My only minor complaint is that the tablet's back cover is kinda slippery and I'm worried I might drop it while I wait for the case to come inn the mail.
customer_reviews.author: Keyes929

customer_reviews.title: Best 8" tab I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: OK it's the only 8" tab I've ever owned. I perviously owned the original Nexus 7 and it was unbearably slow so I did some research and decided on the Shield K1. As far as software is concerned hardly know it's not a Nexus no bloatware. I've had Nexus devices for the last 3 years and have no patience for anything other than pure Android and I am right at home with this tab feels just like a Nexus with a few extra features. Currently running Android 6.0.1, this gets updated a few weeks after my Nexus 5X. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I really like this tablet and it comes with Marshmellow preinstalled
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tablet and it comes with Marshmellow preinstalled, no bloatwaer and nvidia promising a Nougat upgrade hopefully within a few weeks. It's an ideal size for a tablet and easy to hold with a rubberised back. The front speakers are well placed and it supports an SD card and mini hdmi connection which are features unavailable on the majority of tablets. The only negatives I would say to stop me giving it a 5 star is that the screen resolution and ppi is not as high as some other tablets and the wireless is only n when it should be ac which has a maximum through put of 450mps instead of 150.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Moon

customer_reviews.title: THE TABLET WENT ON AN INFINITE STARTUP LOOP
customer_reviews.text: The tablet just went on a infinite startup loop and stayed that way inspite of restarting the device numerous times. I was eagerly looking forward to this tablet and also installed the "SPARIN NVIDIA Shield Tablet / Tablet K1 Screen Protector" as soon as I received my tablet. Needless to say I lost the money I spent on the screen protector. Asked for a replacement for the tablet and was promised a delivery date 6 days into the future inspite of being PRIME eligible.
customer_reviews.author: Prachi Mule

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, powerful
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through about 4 tablets now and this is the best tablet I've ever used. It really feels like I can actually function, not just chug along begrudgingly like most tablets do.
customer_reviews.author: Archaneus

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the price even if you don't plan ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the price even if you don't plan on using Nvidia gaming features. I do and it works well with the Nvidia gamepad. Have also been looking at Remotr and Kinoscope apps to stream games from my non Nvidia PC. If you do games that don't use gamepads your mileage will vary. I'm a Civilizations type player. To play well you'll need a keyboard and mouse to really stream and play on tablet games that are similar in nature. Defeats the mobile streaming IMHO. Overlall I'm happy with purchase and with the current latest and greatest Android release this tablet has held its battery and works great.
customer_reviews.author: JustBill

customer_reviews.title: SCREEN IS AWESOME..
customer_reviews.text: SCREEN IS AWESOME....SOUND IS GREAT....GAMES LIKE NO OTHER AND WITHE THE BUTTON MAPPER THAT IS ALREADY INSTALLED, JUST PLUG IN A PS3 OR XBOX or link a nivida controller.....But I prefer using my $10 moga controller. (here on Amazon). Only downside is that you need a good connection to WiFi ....Just a word of advise.....Connect to your game and the net before connecting a Bluetooth controller
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: I like it. No battery vibration
customer_reviews.text: I like it. No battery vibration, but it is ok. I still do not know how to install apps into the Micro sd card On/off button is so narrow, you have to press all the way. The Micro Sd Cover is not very well designed, it touch the Micro SD card so I spent a lot of time installing the memory. Something to improve for next NVidia tablet I am still happy with the tablet, nice resolution and fast browsing.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo Moriamez Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi reception compared to Samsung Galaxy Note III
customer_reviews.text: Poor wifi reception compared to Samsung Galaxy Note III, Kindle Paperwhite, Asus T-100, Lenovo Yoga 12. This is not an AC vs N thing. Battery life is not good, not terrible. I would not purchase again, but it is a very good deal for $199 or less. Less so for me because I do not use it for gaming - if you are looking for a tablet and don't care about games, the wifi reception, weight, and battery life will be issues. But I am hard pressed to recommend another tablet in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: vodalus

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money it cost! Battery issues towards end of the first year that got progressively worse until it wouldn't even hold a fresh charge.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: After updating it works excellent.
customer_reviews.text: cons: charger sold separately, Would rather have a 14mp camera for this price. It gets hot with most apps running/being used. Pros: battery life is about 8 hrs if screen and wifi is off (music playing). About 2 hrs with videos unless brightness is turned down and video is offline. the camera resolution 1920x1200 back and front with an option to lower the resolution, two speakers on the front that are loud and clear, the options available in settings for features such as screen, apps and such are more in depth than your regular $4 or $70 tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little tablet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality, versatility, screen, battery and sound. We've had ours for quite sometime now and its survived all sorts of abuse. Performance wise, you need to understand its an old device by todays tech standards, but its still blazing on most apps and games. The nvidia chipset really is a beast. Considering buying a newer model one if they release one, when this one kicks the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Shimad

customer_reviews.title: Generally pleased with this device
customer_reviews.text: Generally pleased with this device. It was at the price point I was looking for and the power needed for the apps I wanted to use. Camera functions and general use has been pleasant. What is disappointing is the lack of quality and integrity of the screen for the tablet. Since my purchase, there have been cracks and no hope of replacement or repair that I can find. Disappointing to say the least. And Now, a replacement tablet does not seem to even be an option. Hoping for an update with better glass and A protective CASE!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Sluggish, requires patience
customer_reviews.text: For what it is at the price point its ok. Feels very sluggish in game. UI feels ok without having a game open. 'Game mapper' is suppose to convert the controller to touch gestures but that wasn't super great. I was expecting something different. Few bucks more you could have a non-sluggish iPad and none of the visual jank/lag. It runs about as good as my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 so I didn't gain anything and the Galaxy was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: M. Statkus

customer_reviews.title: great features for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fast, affordable, fast, great features for the price, fast. Seriously, if you're looking for an affordable tablet that you'd want to run something more graphically intensive than angry birds on, you will not find a better one. This tablet scores higher in benchmark tests than devices that cost twice as much. Make sure to update the device to 6.1 (first update is to 6.0, then another to 6.1, 6.1 fixes some issues that this tablet had with 6.0) when you get it, it adds a bunch of features and overall makes the android experience smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming... (Update 2-10-17)
customer_reviews.text: See title. Web browsing is slower than i am used to. It lags when switching tasks. But for 3D games it's great! It does burn through battery life when playing games though. Unit does get warm. But if you are a gamer this shouldn't be a surprise or a bother. I mainly play War Robots and World of Tanks on this. *Update* now that it has been updated to Android 7.0 it's as responsive as any normal tablet. I still love this thing. Gereeeeeat buy for $200 if you are in to gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Gifford Hwa

customer_reviews.title: NVIDIA SHIELD K1 8" Tablet - Black
customer_reviews.text: The tablet started out with with minor issues having light bleed around the screen and bezel, I decided to keep the tablet anyway. Later, the tablet stated to slow way down being barely responsive on some apps. I am no longer using the tablet and will be donating it. This rating was submitted in error. The above rating was intended for the Amazon Fire Tablet AND NOT the NVIDIA Shield K1. I replaced the Amazon Fire Tablet with the NVIDIA Shield K1 and so far, I am pleased with the NVIDIA Shield K1..
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome tablet. The Nvidia Shield does everything very well
customer_reviews.text: Such an awesome tablet. The Nvidia Shield does everything very well. The cameras aren't great, but, seeing as I'm not an old person, I don't really use a tablet for the cameras. For Android gaming and PC gaming mirroring/streaming to TV, this thing can't be beat. Also, you don't even have to buy the expensive controller... any controller will work. Just get a usb to micro usb adapter and plug it into the micro usb slot on the shield, and you can use your xbone, 360, PS4, PS3, and 3rd party controllers with the Shield just fine immediately upon plugging them in -- no fussing with settings required.
customer_reviews.author: Alkavas Vi

customer_reviews.title: Power on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: The best budget tablet out there. It still runs android in 32-bit so some newer applications may or may not work if they drop 32bit support. That being said this thing is powerful. I game on it, I work on it. Does just fine. The only issues I run into are general problems with Android Marshmallow that pretty much all devices have. Feels great in the hands. Screen is accurate and fast, as well as a decent looking picture. Although if you want better go with a higher tiered Samsung or the ASUS. Although it's annoying the high end tablets are going to 4:3 aspect ratio instead of 16:9/16:10.
customer_reviews.author: railerswim

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than I thought
customer_reviews.text: A good tablet. Snappy, smooth, well-made enough. Nice price as well which also explains the cheaper plastics used in some areas. The only gripe I have with this is that it's pretty heavy. And it's not the reassuring kind of heft I'm talking about, because of the cheap plastics. Takes nothing away though from the performance of the thing, with its strong processor and quality touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: E. Massimo

customer_reviews.title: Best Android tablet for gamers
customer_reviews.text: Improvements over the first model: - 4K HDMI-out (not HDCP 2.2 tho; so Netflix stays @1080p) - Wireless AC Good: - Stellar performance - Tegra exclusive games (Half-Life 2, Portal, Doom 3, etc) - Update to Android 6.0 promised before the end of the year - SD card slot with app data migration (and it'll only get better with Marshmallow) - Powerful front-facing speakers - GeForce Now distant streaming service (GRID) - Nvidia GameStream local service (PC streaming) - Console mode - Total Twitch integration Bad: - Average battery life Ugly: - Worst mushy buttons you could ever imagine - Weird noise coming out of the tablet while charging
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a awesome tablet and I love it. I have only one bad thing is that it dose not support some OTG cable. I feel the price of the controller is expensive but I seen them for around 50$ still don't know how I feel spending to much on a controller I can only use for this tablet only. Hopefully when I can order it, it will be worth it. This runs all my emulator without a problem from n64 to psp and even my DS one. No lack of processor speed. The touch screen dose get dirty real quickly. But I carry a cloth so I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: marcos

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for 200 bucks
customer_reviews.text: this tablet is awesome I'm enjoying it a lot, it is very light, feels very sturdy and I love the front facing speakers. the display is nice and bright with rich blacks I only have a couple of complains for this tablet, first the volume and on and off buttons are very hard to click they don't give any feed back whatsoever and they are really close together 1 out 3 times your gonna turn off the tablet instead of turning the volume up, and second the sd comparment is very tricky but other than that I love this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST TABLET MADE YET!
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet made thus far without any doubts. The crazy huge graphics core count, big nice screen, antilag controllers, good cameras, card slot accepts 128GB, big battery, and top of the line Android Updates are what make this a real pc-killer. Plus it has microHDMI out for Console Mode, and all the other accoutrements that come with a smart device nowadays (GPS, compass, accelerometer, etc). 10/10 Could not ask for anything better
customer_reviews.author: Big Guy

customer_reviews.title: Highly advise you purchase this first! Save your time looking at junk, this thing is GOLDEN!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hands down the best tablet for its price! Period!This tablet rolls thru games, apps, casting to televisions, streaming HiFi media, etc. Without a hitch.its expandable media works just great. I purchased a Samsung 128 GB micro SD card and haven't looked back. I purchased a third party case and remote and the K1 gave me no issues, period. The geforce now is new to me, however I have had no issues streaming games, I don't experience lag or frame rate issues. My wife and I have the same tablets, same setups as far as SD cards covers etc. We love this tablet and both highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nick middleton

customer_reviews.title: Glad I gave it away to some other poor sucker.
customer_reviews.text: My wife called this a piece of junk from the moment she got it to the moment I bought her a new LG tablet. Wifi is horrible. Constantly taking the SD card out and putting it back in. The tablet said it wasn't there.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Heckart

customer_reviews.title: The only thing i can say is get a sd card because there isnt a great deal of storage space
customer_reviews.text: Over a year since i bought it and long time since it came out this thing is still a monster. I game stream all the time and even use it to game stream while remote play ps4! Double streaming! I use a female to micro usb and ethernet to usb adapter for fast connection but there is no need it works well over wifi. I dont have a subscription to the gaming service but it seems legit. The only thing i can say is get a sd card because there isnt a great deal of storage space. But if you just use it for streaming you dont need one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet for the Money - Update the OS Before Streaming Movies
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with this tablet. The screen is bright and the images are sharp. I use this for streaming movies and reading e-books, mostly. You're going to want to update the operating system before streaming movies, though. Twice the tablet froze while playing movies, but once the operating system was updated, I have not had a problem. I definitely recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H.

customer_reviews.title: Gaming is amazing, doom 3, half life 2,  just amazing
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet ever, fast and responsive, new android 6 storage is absolutely amazing, with a 128gb sd card you can install lots and lots of games, and I mean it, great game selection, and the emulators with great, hdmi output, what else you can ask for, let me tell you, the baterry life is not stellar but is great, android 6 is a beast, you can't get any better than this, even with a high end tablet, get an anker usb charger for charge it, works great
customer_reviews.author: Powertechreview

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly beautiful graphics and plays smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly beautiful graphics, adequate sound, and plays games incredibly smoothly without hiccups or crashing. If there are any issues about battery life, I will update the review to reflect it. So far, it seemed to have charged fairly quickly. Update: Nevermind, from 48% remaining it estimated 5 hours of charging left. The battery life seems to be less than 4 hours when playing games. I will update this as I am more sure.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang For The Price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the K1 so I can mainly edit 4K videos and use it as a live display with my DJI Mavic Pro while producing no lag. Puts that POS Nexus 7 to ashamed. My only complaint is there's no slot for the stylus, no data cable or charger, and no wireless charging.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Better buy it on Nvidia site for only 149$ Gaming tablet at it's finest but some issues on recording
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for gaming(emulators and other apps) and it's perfect, it run smoothly, great graphics and sound. Update: After a week, i decided to record a game from my tablet which is one of the features of this tablet then it won't work, error "out of storage" but i still have 7gb free internal storage and 50+gb on my sd card. I try to find so solution on their forums but there's none, i hope nvidia fix this, battery is still good
customer_reviews.author: KeyboardWarrior

customer_reviews.title: ... had a Nexus 7 (2013) and it still works great, but the Nexus 7 is at the end ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a Nexus 7 (2013) and it still works great, but the Nexus 7 is at the end of its service life. Google won't update it anymore, and without updates I am not comfortable using it. This tablet is the BEST replacement for the awesome Nexus 7. It's a bit more weighty but I don't mind that is it seems more robust. The display is awesome, the tablet is responsive, and the option to play some awesome games on it really is a added bonus. It can be a full functioning, Google Play apps tablet, or you can game. If you're looking for bang for your buck, and a beautiful machine, but this tablet!
customer_reviews.author: kdennis78

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for travelling. I used it to watch movies on a flight from Chicago to LA on a single charge. Great for media playback and general web browsing. Pros: -Good value Price vs. Hardware -Good battery life -Good built-in speakers -Supports OTG USB (allows you to connect USB peripherals such as a keyboard) Cons: -USB 2.0 limits data transfer speeds. -Charges very slowly on USB
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my phantom 3 drone and it works really well. Great size screen and great hardware specs for the price. This tablet has no problem streaming the live video feed back from the drone and running games and movies. For use with a phantom 3 drone it is perfect and in my opinion the best option. You can plug a mini HDMI cable into it to plug in viewer goggles like fatshark fpv goggles or a TV screen if you want. You can also take the micro SD card out of the drone and plug it into the tablet to review the high definition footage on set and
customer_reviews.author: Maximilian Funke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tablet/price that I've seen out there. It's sleek, great size, great screen, great battery life, feels solid and performs pretty well. It could have a bit more RAM and a bit faster CPU, but that would quickly ramp the price up. I love this little thing and take it with me everywhere. I haven't tried out the controller that's made for it, but I do recommend the NVIDIA cover, even though it's a bit more. Keeps the tablet sleek while giving a stand and protecting the screen.
customer_reviews.author: John Horn

customer_reviews.title: Best value tablet ever!
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best value for 2015 and possibly 2016. The build quality is excellent for a sub $200 tablet and the near stock Android experience is the icing on the cake. I bought this for my son as his first real gaming system. The subscription gaming service is excellent plus you get 3 months free. No tablet can play the games that this tablet can unless you consider a windows tablet and although you can play great games there you loose out on the functionality of Android or ios.
customer_reviews.author: TsicreativeATL

customer_reviews.title: Slow and klugy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for use as my Mavik P2 monitor/controller. Very slow to get up to speed. If I try to use it before it fully boots, (maybe 10 minutes) it can lock up. The battery is short lived. The screen is fairly bright but not workable in daylight without a hood.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Orden

customer_reviews.title: Spots on screen not responsive to touch
customer_reviews.text: He absolutely loves the tablet, but there are some areas on the screen that do not respond to touch. He was showing me the areas and if he rotates the screen it will work until the next time. It is not the entire screen just certain spots. When I went to review my order I noticed that the time for returning the tablet has passed by four days.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is great, and really affordable
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great, and really affordable! As of the date of this review it is on Android 7 and runs smooth. The resolution is beautiful. Front facing speakers make for a loud device when its cranked up to full. I can game stream (with the Nvidia Shield Controller sold seprately) Doom from home to the WiFi at work, and the game is beautiful. I also use this for Nursing school, with the brightness tweaked down and conservative usage the battery will last me through a 12 hour clinical.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Forney

customer_reviews.title: It's Nvidia - I expected better
customer_reviews.text: Performance is sluggish at times...too many times. Battery is mediocre. Latest updates and factory default doesn't help. Front firing speakers are nice. Might be OK for gaming, but is weak for ordinary use. Not a complete junker, I just expected something with the name Shield might be same caliber is Shield TV...it's not.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, just wish it was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this tablet is designed around gaming, it is a great all around tablet too. I use it for class with a bluetooth keyboard and mouse, but you can plug a Xbox 360 controller into and and instantly use it for games. It's designed to have you download games from it's store, but the streaming feature still allows you to play games from your PC. For anyone who has concern about internet usage, the stream seems to just be a video stream from your PC and not streaming the actual game. I wasn't sure of that before purchase, but it's kind of obvious now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Aside from those 3 factors I think this would have been a good unit, I just no longer had the patience ...
customer_reviews.text: I eventually returned the unit after failing to get it to connect to wifi on a regular basis, having issues with heat, and the touch screen requiring unnatural force to register me touching it. Aside from those 3 factors I think this would have been a good unit, I just no longer had the patience to deal with it and will either buy a Samsung or steal my wife's iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. It's fast enough for the needs of most, the GPU is very powerful, the screen is nice enough, decent battery life, nice materials and build quality, and is a giveaway for the price. Compared with the major competition, nothing can touch it. Plus, it's a gaming console, if you're a gamer. This one's a no-brainer - buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Schnittman

customer_reviews.title: I've done system updates and its completly up to date but still no change in the wifi connection maintaining a good connection.
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are ok but the Wifi on it is really lacking. It constantly drops connection. I mean I am in the same room with the wifi and it drops the connection while I am playing a game. I've done system updates and its completly up to date but still no change in the wifi connection maintaining a good connection. Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you want a powerful well sized tablet
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I had this thing for 3 years, gave it to my 6 year old nephew, and it still works. Not only that, but it's power and game streaming capabilities have ensured hours and hours of fun for myself and my family. If I hadn't gotten a tab s3, I would still be using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pugliese

customer_reviews.title: The best tablet ever
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is flat out amazing when compared to any Samsung! I can play games on my computer from anywhere even over 4G cell service. I only have 2 complaints one is that it's only 8" and the other is it only has 32GB of internal storage. It should have a minimum of 64GB and a 10 with a slot for the stylus.
customer_reviews.author: stephen callaway

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tablet! Although if you like to play games ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tablet! Although if you like to play games on it you'll need an SD card real fast those 16 gb go quickly. And a Bluetooth controller. Other than that is the best Android device I've ever owned so it gets a 5 star from me, super responsive and very snappy. The tablet not coming with a charger is not an issue for me because I've got a bunch laying around the house. Games look beautiful, not happy with the 8 hour charge time but the battery lasts long enough that it doesn't matter that much anyways if i could this tablet would get a 6\5
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: A Gem
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong one year later and after 2 major OS upgrades from 5.1 to 7.0. I cannot recommend this tablet any more highly. Combined with a Poetic Turtle skin this is as good as new. Congratulations NVIDIA on a gem in a market of tablets with flaws and limited lifetime upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: It will play ANY program you put on it!
customer_reviews.text: This monster is the POWERHOUSE of tablets! For instance, it can play Half Life 2 with out having any trouble! I even played Undertale on it, using an unofficial port, and it worked fantastic! Graphics capability is amazing and the sound quality is unbelievable for a device that size! The battery life lasts very well compared to other tablets.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Battery and wifi are bad. Useless tablet
customer_reviews.text: This has issues in its battery and wifi connection. Battery issue: charging the tablet sometimes stops although the micro usb power supply is connected. Wifi connection issue: sometimes it fails to connect new wireless network; it stops to connect at the authentication step. Thus, I do not recommend this device to buy. It's cheap, but just cheap. This is useless as a tablet; maybe works as a photo frame.
customer_reviews.author: aki

customer_reviews.title: Cool tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Android 5.1. I also like the stock Android skin. I am not much of a gamer so maybe this review won't add much for some users. I liked the price and just wanted something bigger than my phone for shopping, surfing, and reading books. This fits the ticket. I knocked it down a star because it has frozen twice upon down loading apps. Not a big deal as I just had to re open tabs. It's just a little more laggy than my new way more expensive phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Lary

customer_reviews.title: Light, responsive, incredible screen quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tablet. It's responsive, the screen quality is out of this world, and it's very light. Sometimes it may get laggy when reawakening. If so, I boot it and it comes back to its nice behavior. Used it with the stylus to draw and take notes, and it's a good experience. Hope Nvidia keeps doing a good job with these babies.
customer_reviews.author: G. R. Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet with Wifi issues, the adapter stops working at random
customer_reviews.text: Wi-Fi doesn't respond! It seems to just be a software issue that's out there, I have read over 100 post related to this subject. The Wi-Fi adapter gets stuck in a search mode and wont respond to commands even after resets and reboots and repurchases! Great in every way except when it just stops working because everything needs Wi-Fi!
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for Games, Rugged for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I got this for reading, games, and videos during my travels. It's a solid, tablet, with a nice solid build. I have no fears about throwing this in my briefcase. Battery is nice and long, even when playing video. I can get through a 6 - 8 hour flight, and still have 20% to 30% of battery left. Important note, it DOES NOT come with a charger or cable. It uses a standard micro-USB. But remember that in case you don't have a spare around.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Greathouse

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tablet for the money. The lack of a charger is petty, but who doesn't have a bunch of them. They keep the software up to date, and it comes with few pre-installed apps, which is really a good thing since other than the nVidia Shield app it's basically all stock Google stuff. It can be a little glitchy when changing orientation but for the price has a great screen and is plenty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Desoto61

customer_reviews.title: THE perfect tablet
customer_reviews.text: I think the fact that i waited months for this to release says something about the quality of the product. Nvidia didn't try to reinvent the wheel with this one, they took what was good with the previous tablet and carried it over to improve upon the design. I just wish they included the OEM Nvidia case to go with it - mine just arrived and it fits so perfect that it seems like it should have be included with full retail purchases. But not even that is enough for me to give this 4 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet. Finally catching up with the times.
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with battery drain until I figured out that turning off WiFi scanning would prevent the CPU from sticking at 100% until the battery died. Now that that problem isn't an issue anymore, I'd give it 5 stars. Very fast and the screen is the perfect size for reading and gaming. Love the fact I can take it anywhere and plug it in to an HDMI equipped TV and game and watch shows and movies. This is the tablet I've always wanted.
customer_reviews.author: T. Masoner

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gaming device, just remember to get the controller, it is a MUST for this device. If you have a nvidia core n your computer its even better. This baby is welllll worth the $200. Not all games work with it that you can get through the google play app store - but many do and it has its own special store as well. For $8 a month you can also get a really crazy lbrary of games and whatnot as well
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great, it works great, looks great and has amazing capabilities. I use if for flying a Phantom 3 mostly, but find myself turning to it for quick movie watching before bed and also for minor mobile games. I do not have NVIDIA in my Gaming Rig, so I can't remark on those features, but maybe it is time for a GPU upgrade so I can get the most out of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Fast and furious, poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Decent performance and awesome feature to stream my computer screen to the tablet. The battery life sucks though, getting worse after a year. I even replaced the battery and the problem still persists. I think it seems to be an issue with battery charging, maybe the micro USB port is damaged.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Better specs than a Nexus, nearly as good support
customer_reviews.text: The tablet performs well, has industry leading specs, and receives Android updates almost as fast as Nexus products. I've had products that were abandoned or lagged a year behind the latest Android spec. This holds well in one hand, has a decent display, decent battery life, and performs very well (Doom 3 on this is a joy).
customer_reviews.author: M. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Excelent value on this Android Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Little problem with a couple programs, but very powerful and well worth the price point for an android tablet. Streams movies great, havent had any lagging in any game i have tried like GTA, Need for Speed, and the like. love this tab. Did have to ruturn the first one i received due to a dead sceen, but Amazon quickly sent a new one. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: KLS

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet Ive touched
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet Ive touched. Price and specs considered this is a real home-run of a device. Screen is a bit sensitive as you dont have to quite touch it to select something so if you want it to do a lot of typing keep that in mind and get a Bluetooth keyboard or something.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: So I am assuming this is a "used like new" tablet
customer_reviews.text: First off this tablet is advertised as "new" but when I received it the tape closing the box was already cut. So I am assuming this is a "used like new" tablet. That was disconcerting. It doesn't hold a charge very well and when turned on once, lost all apps until I restarted. I'm wondering if I got a lemon passed off on me
customer_reviews.author: Windmills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet is an amazing tablet it really is good for gamers the 1080p 8-inch screen makes everything look amazing adding the game and controller is the best option for certain games and Nvidia now really enhances the tablet's performance even though my mailman ended up throwing it at the door it's still intact would recommend for any gamer who likes Nvidia products.
customer_reviews.author: Item helper

customer_reviews.title: great gaming performance
customer_reviews.text: great gaming performance. great overall tablet for low budget. but not as fast, thin or good on battery as newer tablets.
